On this page Annotations Currently we support the following annotations: Arrow Circle Ellipse Line Polygon Polyline Rectangle Shape Text Loading... Show Live Editor function Demo() { const { Line, Circle, Ellipse, Rectangle, Text, Arrow } = Annotation; return ( <Plot width={300} height={300}> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 1 }, { x: 2, y: 2 }, { x: 3, y: 3 }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 }, ]} /> <Annotations> <Line x1="10" y1="10" x2="100" y2="100" color="yellow" strokeWidth="4" /> <Arrow x1="10" y1="30" x2="100" y2="130" color="yellow" strokeWidth="4" /> <Circle r="20" x="200" y="20" color="blue"></Circle> <Ellipse rx="20" ry="10" x="200" y="100" color="green"></Ellipse> <Rectangle x1="20" y1="100" x2="50" y2="150" color="violet"></Rectangle> <Text x="150" y="200" fontSize="30" fontFamily="monospace" fontWeight="bold" textAnchor="middle" color="orange" > Hello world </Text> </Annotations> <Axis position="bottom" /> <Axis position="left" /> </Plot> ); } function Demo() { const { Line, Circle, Ellipse, Rectangle, Text, Arrow } = Annotation; return ( <Plot width={300} height={300}> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 1 }, { x: 2, y: 2 }, { x: 3, y: 3 }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 }, ]} /> <Annotations> <Line x1="10" y1="10" x2="100" y2="100" color="yellow" strokeWidth="4" /> <Arrow x1="10" y1="30" x2="100" y2="130" color="yellow" strokeWidth="4" /> <Circle r="20" x="200" y="20" color="blue"></Circle> <Ellipse rx="20" ry="10" x="200" y="100" color="green"></Ellipse> <Rectangle x1="20" y1="100" x2="50" y2="150" color="violet"></Rectangle> <Text x="150" y="200" fontSize="30" fontFamily="monospace" fontWeight="bold" textAnchor="middle" color="orange" > Hello world </Text> </Annotations> <Axis position="bottom" /> <Axis position="left" /> </Plot> ); } Shapeâ€‹ Groupâ€‹ Edit this page Previous Axis Next Hooks Shape Group

Infrared spectrum Example of code loading and converting a jcamp (using jcampconverter) Loading... Show Live Editor function ZoomablePlot() { const [data, setData] = useState(); const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); useEffect(async () => { const response = await fetch("/data/ir.jdx"); const jcamp = await response.text(); const data = xyToXYObject( convertJcamp(jcamp).flatten[0].spectra[0].data ).map((point) => ({ x: point.x, y: point.y * 100 })); setData(data); }, []); return (
{data ? ( {zoom.annotations} ) : undefined}
); } render( ); function ZoomablePlot() { const [data, setData] = useState(); const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); useEffect(async () => { const response = await fetch("/data/ir.jdx"); const jcamp = await response.text(); const data = xyToXYObject( convertJcamp(jcamp).flatten[0].spectra[0].data ).map((point) => ({ x: point.x, y: point.y * 100 })); setData(data); }, []); return (
{data ? ( {zoom.annotations} ) : undefined}
); } render( ); Edit this page Previous Hooks Next Mass spectrum

On this page Hooks react-plot provides hook that allows to add functionalities to the plot. To benefit of those features the hooks have to be wrapped in a PlotController. Some hooks like useRectangularZoom will apply by default to all the Plot components contained in the PlotController. In the same page there may be many Plot components group in different PlotController components. useStartMoveEndâ€‹ The low level hook useStartMoveEnd allows to track the mouse. This hook is used by other hooks but can also be used natively. If accepts 3 callbacks: onStart: the mouse was clicked onMove: the mouse was dragged onEnd: the mouse was released In the following example we simply log the different events. Loading... Show Live Editor function TrackablePlot() { const [currentEvent, setCurrentEvent] = useState(); const tracker = useStartMoveEnd({ onStart: (event) => { setCurrentEvent({ kind: "onStart", event }); }, onMove: (event) => { setCurrentEvent({ kind: "onMove", event }); }, onEnd: (event) => { setCurrentEvent({ kind: "onEnd", event }); }, }); return (
); } render( ); function TrackablePlot() { const [currentEvent, setCurrentEvent] = useState(); const tracker = useStartMoveEnd({ onStart: (event) => { setCurrentEvent({ kind: "onStart", event }); }, onMove: (event) => { setCurrentEvent({ kind: "onMove", event }); }, onEnd: (event) => { setCurrentEvent({ kind: "onEnd", event }); }, }); return (
); } render( ); useDrawRectangleâ€‹ A more advanced hook will not only monitor the movement of the mouse but will also return annotations that can directly be drawn in the Plot. wrap your plot component in add the hook: const drawRectangle = useDrawRectangle(); add the drawRectangle.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: {drawRectangle.annotations} Loading... Show Live Editor function DrawRectanglePlot() { const drawRectangle = useDrawRectangle(); return ( {drawRectangle.annotations} ); } render( ); function DrawRectanglePlot() { const drawRectangle = useDrawRectangle(); return ( {drawRectangle.annotations} ); } render( ); useRectangularZoomâ€‹ This hook allows directly to manage the zoom in a plot. There are 3 steps in order ot implement the zoom: wrap your plot component in add the hook: const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); add the zoom.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: {zoom.annotations} This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Loading... Show Live Editor function ZoomablePlot() { const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); return ( {zoom.annotations} ); } render( ); function ZoomablePlot() { const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); return ( {zoom.annotations} ); } render( ); If a PlotController contains many Plot the change will be applied on all of them. Loading... Show Live Editor function ZoomablePlot() { const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); return ( {zoom.annotations} ); } render( ); function ZoomablePlot() { const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); return ( {zoom.annotations} ); } render( ); useAxisZoomâ€‹ This hook allows to zoom in a plot along the specified axis (default to horitzontal). There are 3 steps in order ot implement the zoom: wrap your plot component in add the hook: const zoom = useAxisZoom({direction:'horizontal'}); add the zoom.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: {zoom.annotations} This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Loading... Show Live Editor function ZoomablePlot() { const zoom = useAxisZoom(); return ( {zoom.annotations} ); } render( ); function ZoomablePlot() { const zoom = useAxisZoom(); return ( {zoom.annotations} ); } render( ); Edit this page Previous Annotations Next Infrared spectrum useStartMoveEnd useDrawRectangle useRectangularZoom useAxisZoom

On this page Series There are currently 5 different kind of series that can be added in a plot: LineSeries ScatterSeries FunctionSeries BarSeries RangeSeries Series are direct children of the Plot component and you may have as many Series as you which on the same plot. LineSeriesâ€‹ Loading... Show Live Editor <Plot width={300} height={300}> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 1 }, { x: 2, y: 2 }, { x: 3, y: 3 }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 }, ]} lineStyle={{ stroke: "blue" }} displayMarker={true} markerShape="circle" markerSize="8" markerStyle={{ fill: "yellow" }} /> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 2 }, { x: 2, y: 1 }, { x: 3, y: 2 }, { x: 4, y: 1 }, { x: 5, y: 2 }, ]} lineStyle={{ stroke: "green" }} /> </Plot> <Plot width={300} height={300}> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 1 }, { x: 2, y: 2 }, { x: 3, y: 3 }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 }, ]} lineStyle={{ stroke: "blue" }} displayMarker={true} markerShape="circle" markerSize="8" markerStyle={{ fill: "yellow" }} /> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 2 }, { x: 2, y: 1 }, { x: 3, y: 2 }, { x: 4, y: 1 }, { x: 5, y: 2 }, ]} lineStyle={{ stroke: "green" }} /> </Plot> LineSeries with error barsâ€‹ Loading... Show Live Editor <Plot width={300} height={300}> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 1, xError: 0.2 }, { x: 2, y: 2, yError: 0.05 }, { x: 3, y: 3, xError: [0.1, 0.2], yError: [0.2, 0.3] }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 }, ]} lineStyle={{ stroke: "blue" }} displayErrorBars={true} errorBarsCapSize={"5"} errorBarsStyle={{ strokeWidth: 1 }} errorBarsCapStyle={{ stroke: "blue" }} /> <Axis min={0} max={6} id="x" position="bottom" /> <Axis min={0} max={4} id="y" position="left" /> </Plot> <Plot width={300} height={300}> <LineSeries data={[ { x: 1, y: 1, xError: 0.2 }, { x: 2, y: 2, yError: 0.05 }, { x: 3, y: 3, xError: [0.1, 0.2], yError: [0.2, 0.3] }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 }, ]} lineStyle={{ stroke: "blue" }} displayErrorBars={true} errorBarsCapSize={"5"} errorBarsStyle={{ strokeWidth: 1 }} errorBarsCapStyle={{ stroke: "blue" }} /> <Axis min={0} max={6} id="x" position="bottom" /> <Axis min={0} max={4} id="y" position="left" /> </Plot> ScatterSeriesâ€‹ Loading...
